text: Jhanduke (sometimes spelled as Jhanduka) is a village in the Sardulgarh tehsil of Mansa district in Punjab, India. Jhunir is the surrounding village. ==Demographics== According to 2011 census of India {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left; hight:70%;" !Subject !Total !Male !Female |--bgcolor="#ffcccc" |Number of houses |991 | | |- |--bgcolor="#ccffcc" | Population |5,220 |2709 |2511 |--bgcolor="#ffcccc" |Children (0-6) |617 |329 |288 |--bgcolor="#ccffcc" |Scheduled Caste |1,800 |922 |878 |--bgcolor="#ffcccc" |Backward class |0 |0 |0 |--bgcolor="#ccffcc" |Literacy rate |55.62 % |62.39 % |48.36 % |--bgcolor="#ffcccc" |Workers |2,245 |1,543 |702 |--bgcolor="#ccffcc" |Main workers |1,980 |0 |0 |--bgcolor="#ffcccc" |Marginal workers |265 |107 |158 |} == Religion == The population mostly follows the Sikhism with Hinduism. ==References== Category:Villages in Mansa district, India
title: Jhanduke
